Class PieceRenderer

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.view.PieceRenderer
public class PieceRenderer extends Object
Handles the rendering of Tetris pieces on various display panels. This class is responsible for creating and updating the visual representation of game pieces, including current pieces, ghost pieces, next piece previews, and the hold piece display.

Main responsibilities:

  • Converting piece data arrays into visual Rectangle objects
  • Managing piece colors and styling
  • Rendering pieces on preview panels
  • Creating ghost piece visualizations

  • Method Details

    • getFillColor

      public javafx.scene.paint.Paint getFillColor(int colorCode)
      Gets the Paint color corresponding to a color code. Uses the TetrisColor enum to map numeric codes to actual colors.
      Parameters:
      colorCode - the numeric color code (0-7)
      Returns:
      the Paint object representing the color

    • createStyledBrick

      public javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle createStyledBrick(int colorCode)
      Creates a Rectangle with standard brick styling. Applies the game's standard brick size, corner radius, and stroke properties.
      Parameters:
      colorCode - the color code for this brick
      Returns:
      a styled Rectangle representing a game brick

    • createPreviewBrick

      public javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle createPreviewBrick()
      Creates a Rectangle for preview panels with appropriate sizing. Preview bricks are slightly smaller than game bricks to allow for grid spacing.
      Returns:
      a Rectangle sized for preview panels

    • createGhostBrick

      public javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle createGhostBrick()
      Creates a ghost piece Rectangle with semi-transparent styling. Ghost pieces show where the current piece will land if dropped.
      Returns:
      a styled Rectangle for ghost piece display

    • renderPieceOnPreview

      public void renderPieceOnPreview(int[][] pieceData, javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle[][] rectangles)
      Renders a piece on a preview panel (next piece or hold piece).

      Centers the piece within a 4x4 grid and applies appropriate colors.

      Parameters:
      pieceData - the 2D array representing the piece shape and colors
      rectangles - the 2D array of Rectangle objects in the panel

    • initializePreviewPanel

      public javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle[][] initializePreviewPanel(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane panel)
      Initializes a preview panel with a grid of Rectangle objects.

      Sets up the GridPane with appropriate spacing and padding.

      Parameters:
      panel - the GridPane to initialize
      Returns:
      a 2D array of Rectangle objects representing the grid

    • clearPreviewPanel

      public void clearPreviewPanel(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle[][] rectangles)
      Clears all rectangles in a preview panel to transparent. Used when there is no piece to display.
      Parameters:
      rectangles - the 2D array of Rectangle objects to clear

    • applyBrickStyling

      public void applyBrickStyling(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle rectangle, int colorCode)
      Applies styling to a Rectangle based on its color code. Sets fill color, stroke, and corner radius according to game standards.
      Parameters:
      rectangle - the Rectangle to style
      colorCode - the color code to apply (0-7)
